othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Covers pre-save validations, conditional checks, and update logic performed before a form is persisted.

body.p: The Before Save event is executed when you click Save or Save & Continue and the logic is executed before you save the event. This event is used to validate the conditions before the form is saved.

p.uicontrol: Use Case# Validate if the value of a field exceeds the acceptable limits

body.p: In the Request For Proposal (RFP) form, if you want a validation message to display if the total amount of the RFP is more than 20% of the total contract cost, then you can use the Before Save event to define the acceptable range of a value for the appropriate field.

p.uicontrol: Use Case# Insert or update fields in a form from another form based on defined condition

body.p: In the Expenses form, if you want to update the records with the rows from the pay items of the associated Purchase Order (PO), then you can use the Before Save event to define the conditions.
